text: Carshalton railway station is a railway station at Carshalton in the London Borough of Sutton in South London. It is located between Sutton and Hackbridge. The station opened on 1st October 1868. The two main trains that run in this station is Southern and Thameslink. This station is in fare zone 5. ==Platforms== There are two station in this station. Platform 1 is for trains towards Central London and Bedfordshire. This includes trains towards Victoria station, St Albans and Luton. Platform 2 is for southbound trains. This includes trains to Sutton (Surrey) and Epsom. ==Frequency== This list shows the frequency of trains on typical off-peak hours. ===Up (northbound)=== * 2 to Victoria Station via Balham station * 1 to St Albans via St Pancras station * 1 to Luton via St Pancras station ===Down (southbound)=== * 2 to Sutton (Surrey) (last stop) * 2 to Epsom via Sutton (Surrey) ==Buses== London buses routes 127, 157 and S3 operate at this station. ==Departures== This table shows the departures from this station with the calling points and the time that is taken to get to the end of the line.
